Class Event

java.lang.Object
Event
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bell, FansOff, FansOn, LightOff, LightOn, PowerOut, Restart, Terminate, ThermostatDay, ThermostatNight, WaterOff, WaterOn, WindowMalfunction
public abstract class Event
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable
The Main Class for GreenhouseControls to create an Event for the Greenhouse to run.
Author:
Craig Kubinec ID:3433193
See Also:
GreenhouseControls, Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event​(GreenhouseControls greenhouseControls, long delayTime)
      Instantiates a new Event.
      Parameters:
      greenhouseControls - the current instance of greenhouseControls.
      delayTime - the delay time for the event to run at.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Start. Sets the time the Event will run at.

    • restarting

      public void restarting()
      Restarting. Sets the time the Event will run at after pausing the Thread.

    • ready

      public boolean ready()
      Allows the System to know when to run the Event when its time is Greater than current time.
      Returns:
      true if Event time is greater than the current time

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Pauses the Event.

    • unPause

      public void unPause()
      Resumes the event.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the Event.

    • action

      public abstract void action() throws java.lang.Exception
      Calls Events action method.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - the Exception.

    • run

      public void run()
      When an object implementing interface Runnable is used to create a thread, starting the thread causes the object's run method to be called in that separately executing thread.

      The general contract of the method run is that it may take any action whatsoever.

      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
      See Also:
      Thread#run()
